intro: Airella cupaniana, commonly known as the cupana marsh sedge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of water bodies. It has slender, triangular stems and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Airella cupaniana plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
